definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Our security is assured by our perseverance and by our sure belief in the success of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 对自由的坚信不移和坚忍不拔是我们安全的保证。

sentences.english: Only by hard study and much patience can one master a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 只有靠努力学习和坚忍不拔的意志才能掌握外语。

sentences.english: Stick with it Douglas. Your fortitude is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯坚持下去，你的坚忍不拔是我们大家的榜样。

sentences.english: Do you want to be courageous, disciplined, creative, and persistent or not?
sentences.chinese: 你是否希望自己勇敢，自制，敢于创新并且坚忍不拔？

sentences.english: Perseverance is a quality that behoves in a scientist.
sentences.chinese: 坚忍不拔是科学家应当具备的品质。

sentences.english: Google is pretty relentless, so that's very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌确实坚忍不拔，所以这很有意思。

sentences.english: We should stick to and develop the heritage of persistency.
sentences.chinese: 我们应坚持和发扬坚忍不拔的传统。

definition: to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
